message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.MM 

This paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) sub-category as it deals with image segmentation using Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) and Hierarchical Conditional Random Fields (HCRFs). It also involves the use of graph-based post-processing to improve segmentation performance. 

The paper may also belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category as it involves the use of CNNs and HCRFs, which are both machine learning techniques. 

The Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category is also likely as the proposed method involves the use of machine learning techniques to assist histopathologists in medical work. 

The Information Retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category is a possibility as the proposed method involves the localization of abnormal regions in gastric histopathology images, which can be seen as a form of information retrieval. 

Finally, the Multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category is also a possibility as the proposed method deals with image segmentation in the context of medical imaging.
